title: NASA’s Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter Views Blue Ghost on Moon’s Surface
summary: NASA’s LRO (Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter) imaged Firefly Aerospace’s Blue Ghost Mission 1 lunar lander on the Moon’s surface the afternoon of March 2, not quite 10 hours after the spacecraft landed. The delivery is part of NASA’s CLPS (Commercial Lunar Payload Services) initiative and Artemis campaign. This is the first CLPS delivery for Firefly, and […]

title: NASA’s Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter Views IM-2 on Moon’s Surface
summary: NASA’s LRO (Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter) imaged Intuitive Machines’ IM-2 on the Moon’s surface on March 7, just under 24 hours after the spacecraft landed. Later that day Intuitive Machines called an early end of mission for IM-2, which carried NASA technology demonstrations as part of the agency’s CLPS (Commercial Lunar Payload Services) initiative and Artemis […]

title: Companies in the Space Force commercial reserve program will not be publicly identified
summary:
The CASR initiative is designed to establish a reserve fleet of commercial satellites to augment government-owned systems in times of crisis.

summary:

title: NASA terminating $420 million in contracts
summary:
NASA is terminating $420 million in contracts the agency says are redundant or “misaligned” with its core priorities, but has provided few details about what is being cut.
The post NASA terminating $420 million in contracts appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: ESA Issues Call for European Launcher Challenge Proposals
summary:
The European Space Agency has officially published a call for proposals for its European Launcher Challenge (ELC). Initiated in November 2023, the programme aims to support the development of new sovereign European launch capabilities. While the challenge will initially focus on small launch capacities, ESA ultimately envisions it as paving the way for a successor […]
The post ESA Issues Call for European Launcher Challenge Proposals appeared first on European Spaceflight.
